data.title: A&R Worldwide Newsletter Vol. 807
data.meta_description: A&R Worldwide Newsletter: The latest Music Industry news curated by Sat Bisla and the A&R Worldwide Team since 1998.
data.text:
RENOWNED BRITISH MUSIC EXECUTIVE

PROFESSOR JONATHAN SHALIT OBE

TO RECEIVE THE DISTINGUISHED MUSEXPO 2024

“INTERNATIONAL LIFETIME ACHIEVEMENT AWARD”

IMAGINE DRAGONS SIGN GLOBAL PUBLISHING DEAL

WITH WARNER CHAPPELL MUSIC

RAJA KUMARI SIGNS TO DOWNTOWN MUSIC PUBLISHING: Downtown Music Publishing (DMP) recently announced a deal with Grammy-nominated singer/songwriter and rapper, Raja Kumari. The American artist recently released her debut album, The Bridge, through her own label, Godmother Records. The agreement with DMP encompasses administration for The Bridge and all her future writing credits. Kumari’s career includes collaborations with renowned artists like John Legend for Johnny Walker’s India campaign. With over 43 million combined Spotify streams, she has left her mark on several chart-topping hits, such as Fall Out Boy’s “Centuries” and Iggy Azalea’s “Change Your Life” featuring T.I. Notably, her song “Set Me Free” featured in Baz Luhrmann’s Netflix series, The Get Down. Having signed with Nas’ label Mass Appeal India in 2020, Kumari later ventured out to establish her own record label, Godmother Records. She has also done contributions to albums by artists like Gwen Stefani, Fifth Harmony, Twin Shadow, Dirty South, and others. Kumari’s vision as a writer extends beyond her own artistry, aiming to provide the soundtrack for more South Asian stories in film and television and introducing cultural sounds to mainstream audiences. Raja Kumari has a U.S. tour in the works for later this year.

DISTILLER MUSIC GROUP & STELLAR SONGS SIGN GIL LEWIS: Distiller Publishing has announced a new collaboration with songwriter and producer, Gil Lewis. The co-publishing agreement, in partnership with Stellar Songs and part of a larger venture with Tim Blacksmith and Danny D’s publishing company, will be globally administered by Warner Chappell Music. Based in London, Gil Lewis has recently collaborated with an impressive roster of artists, including MNEK, Jin Jin, Digital Farm Animals, Gracey, Nina Nesbitt, and more. Currently, he’s working with Sophie & The Giants, Fin Askew, and other artists. Claire Bianchi, Head of A&R, Distiller Publishing helped with brokering the new signing deal.

GOING DUTCH WITH A NEW CATALOG ACQUISITION: CTM Outlander has successfully acquired the esteemed Dutch music company, Strengholt Music Group, marking a significant achievement for the rapidly expanding indie music publisher. Founded in 1928, Strengholt Music Group has been a prominent player in the Dutch music industry and was formerly known as Warner Basart Music Publishers. With offices worldwide, the company has played a pivotal role in the Dutch music entertainment scene. The acquisition includes a rich catalog featuring over 100 No.1 hits, composed by renowned artists such as Boudewijn de Groot, Lennaert Nijgh, Ramses Shaffy, Pierre Kartner, Hans van Hemert, Ferry Corsten, Radboud Miedema, John Ewbank, Eric van Tijn, and Jochem Fluitsma. Notably, the song “Engelbewaarder” by Marco Schuitmaker, written four decades ago, currently holds the No.1 spot in the Netherlands. Among the worldwide hits in the catalogue are iconic tracks like “Venus” by Shocking Blue and Bananarama, “Eviva España” by Imca Marina, “I Remember Elvis Presley” by Danny Mirror, and more. Purple Eye Publishing and Purple Eye Entertainment’s management and music rights activities will remain separate and unaffected by this transaction.

IDOL SIGNS AFRO B AND YEMI ALADE, HIRES NEW INT’L A&R: Independent digital distributor IDOL has made new artist services deals, expanding its roster with two diverse African genres. The first signing is Nigeria’s renowned afropop artist Yemi Alade, represented by her record company Effyzzie Music. Alade is collaborating with IDOL on her seventh studio album, scheduled for release later this year. The second addition is London-based afrowave pioneer and Capital XTRA DJ Afro B, who will release several singles this year leading up to his fourth album in 2024, featuring collaborations with Stefflon Don, will.i.am, Pitbull, and more. IDOL will handle global digital distribution for both artists, providing support in strategy, marketing, audience development, and channel management. These signings underscore IDOL’s commitment to promoting diverse African genres, which have experienced significant growth, with the Sub-Saharan African music market witnessing a 34.7% revenue increase in 2022 according to IFPI. IDOL’s subsidiary publication, Pan African Music (PAM), also plays a role in championing African music and culture globally with its high-quality, locally driven content.

UNIVERSAL MUSIC GROUP N.V. REPORTS FINANCIAL RESULTS: Universal Music Group N.V. has reported its financial results for Q2 and H1 of 2023, showcasing continued strong performance and growth opportunities for the music ecosystem. Despite a decline in EBITDA for Q2, revenue increased by 6.4% YoY (8.8% in constant currency), driven by growth in Recorded Music and Merchandising segments. EBITDA margin was impacted by non-cash share-based compensation expenses due to the global equity compensation plan rollout. However, excluding these expenses, Adjusted EBITDA rose by 16.4% YoY (19.2% in constant currency), and Adjusted EBITDA margin improved to 21.9%. In H1 2023, UMG’s revenue increased by 8.7% (9.1% in constant currency) driven by improvements across all segments. The company’s cost of revenues decreased as a percentage of revenue due to lower merchandising product costs. While EBITDA declined, Adjusted EBITDA rose by 15.6% YoY (16.2% in constant currency) with a margin expansion of 1.3pp, attributed to revenue growth, operating leverage, and cash compensation savings from the equity plan rollout. Operating profit saw a decline due to higher non-cash share-based compensation expenses in H1 2023. UMG continues to focus on its artist-centric approach and strategic investments to drive long-term shareholder value. Read the full report HERE.

AWAL NAMES NEW SR. VP & HEAD OF URBAN MUSIC: AWAL has appointed Norva Denton as its new Sr. Vice President and Head of Urban Music. Operating from AWAL’s Los Angeles office, Denton will contribute to the A&R team, reporting to President Pete Giberga. His main focus will be to strengthen and expand AWAL’s urban music roster by strategically signing new artists. Denton brings a wealth of experience to the position, having previously served as Sr. VP of A&R at Warner Records. During his tenure, he successfully signed, developed, and nurtured the careers of notable acts such as YFN Lucci, Wale, Taykeith, Chika, and 2KBABY. Additionally, Denton co-wrote and produced various records, showcasing his diverse talents as a music executive. Born and raised in Chicago, Denton began his career as the West Coast Regional Director of Artist Development at Motown/Island Def Jam in New York, where he worked with a range of artists, including Big Sean, 2 Chainz, Logic, and more.

MUSHROOM GROUP LAUNCHES MG LIVE: Australian music and entertainment company Mushroom Group has unveiled MG Live, a new live entertainment unit that will consolidate Mushroom’s touring and events businesses. Led by Mushroom Group Chairman & CEO Matt Gudinski, MG Live will bring together promoter brands such as Illusive Presents, I OH YOU Touring, and Arena Touring, along with various event companies and brands like Roundhouse Entertainment and a day on the green. The unit will work in collaboration with sister company Frontier Touring, presenting tours for artists like Tyler, The Creator, Ed Sheeran, and more, collectively selling over 1.3 million tickets in the past year. MG Live’s upcoming plans include managing tours for Robbie Williams and The Chicks, as well as announcements for Fridayz Live and Boiler Room, among others. This new addition follows Mushroom Group’s recent introduction of other units, including a booking agency called MBA, talent management division Mushroom Management, and neighboring rights firm Good Neighbour.

SONGTRADR PARTNERS WITH TWITCH VIA PRETZEL: Songtradr has announced its partnership with Twitch. The deal sees Songtradr bringing their music service, Pretzel to Twitch, to enhance live streams with a treasure trove of licensed music. Acquired by Songtradr in 2021, Pretzel offers “stream safe” tracks for platforms like Twitch and YouTube. Through September 15th, Twitch streamers can enjoy a 90-day free trial of Pretzel’s premium subscription tier, boasting over 550,000 Twitch-safe tracks. The platform also caters to professional content creators with a ‘Pro’ subscription tier. Beyond Twitch, Pretzel provides 100,000+ YouTube-safe tracks and 50,000+ downloadable tracks. With over half a million users, Pretzel is making waves in the livestreaming community. Songtradr’s CEO, Paul Wiltshire, stated that he is very optimistic about this collaboration, offering streamers fully licensed music for their Twitch streams.

GEORGE DRAKOULIAS JOINS PREMIER MUSIC GROUP: Premier Music Group, the renowned music strategy and supervision company, has made a significant acquisition by welcoming music supervisor and producer George Drakoulias to their leadership team as a partner and creative director. Drakoulias’ impressive career began at Def Jam Records under Rick Rubin, and he has since worked on supervising music for numerous blockbuster films and TV series, including Joker, The Batman, Marriage Story, Barbie and more. His expertise also extends to executive A&R roles and music production for acclaimed artists like Tom Petty and the Heartbreakers, The Black Crowes, and Primal Scream. As he joins Premier Music Group, George Drakoulias will open their new Los Angeles offices, adding his relationships and experience to their roster of creative executives. Premier’s CEO, Josh Deutsch, expresses admiration for Drakoulias’ talents and believes his partnership will contribute significantly to Premier’s growth and solidify their position as a leading music supervision firm across all market segments.

INSOMNIAC AND EMO NITE ANNOUNCE CREATIVE PARTNERSHIP: Insomniac has joined forces with Emo Nite to announce a multi-faceted partnership. This collaboration will encompass various exclusive projects, including events, music, and apparel, showcasing the creative synergy between the two promoters. One of the projects in this partnership is the launch of a new event series called GRAVE RAVE, set to debut in Los Angeles this December. GRAVE RAVE will fuse electronic music with the melodies of emo, pop-punk, and rock genres, featuring performances from both iconic and emerging bands and DJs. The series will kick off with a ‘Road to GRAVE RAVE’ preview party at Insomniac’s Academy LA venue, offering fans a mix of electronic and emo mashups. In addition to the event series, Emo Nite is now part of the Insomniac Music Group family, with the launch of its own record label, Graveboy Records. Music and apparel collaborations are also on the horizon, with the debut of the “Insomniac x Emo Nite” collaborative merch collection at HARD Summer 2023.

SEEKER MUSIC NAMES NEW SR. DIRECTOR OF MARKETING: Seeker Music, the global Los Angeles-based music rights, publishing, and record company has promoted John Bowditch to Sr. Director of Marketing. Having joined Seeker as one of its early employees in 2021, Bowditch has been instrumental in successful catalog campaigns for artists like Christopher Cross and Run The Jewels, as well as spearheading frontline releases from Kito, tiLLie, CARR, and more. With a background in music marketing and strategy, Bowditch’s objective is to treat catalogs as frontline priorities, recognizing the profound impact these songs have on fans’ lives. Evan Bogart, Seeker CEO and hit songwriter, commends Bowditch’s visionary insights and cultural awareness, highlighting how his marketing expertise elevates the brand and identity of each catalog and songwriter. As Senior Director of Marketing, Bowditch will oversee all marketing activities for both catalog and frontline business, contributing to Seeker’s creative objectives alongside the leadership team.

AMR SONGS LAUNCHES CHRISTIAN MUSIC DIVISION: AMR Songs, founded by Tamara Conniff, is making significant strides in the Christian music genre with the launch of a new Christian division and the acquisition of a diverse catalog of songs by top artists and songwriters. The company has secured interests in the master recordings of Grammy-nominated Christian rock band Sanctus Real, known for hits like “Confidence” and “Unstoppable God.” Additionally, AMR has acquired the publishing catalog of Phil Wickham, celebrated for songs like “This Is Amazing Grace” and “Your Love Awakens Me.” Additionally, the company has added Christian artists Christy Nockels and Nathan Nockels, who bring a wealth of worship and inspirational music to AMR. The Christian rap genre is also represented, with AMR gaining interests in the catalog of Kevin “KB” Burgess, whose hits include “100” and “Church Clap” featuring Grammy-winning rapper Lecrae. Lastly, AMR has acquired the publishing catalog of artist and songwriter Ryan Stevenson, featuring the Grammy-nominated single “Speak Life” co-written with TobyMac.

ANGRY MOB’S THE NEW NORMAL WRITING CAMP IN LA: The New Normal Writing Camp, organized by Los Angeles-based Angry Mob Music Group, brought together an array of artists, writers, and producers from diverse cultural backgrounds in Downtown Los Angeles last month. Over five days, from June 26-30, more than 30 participants collaborated in an environment that fostered creativity and inclusivity. The camp included 50% women producers and 70% female writers/artists among its attendees. Founded by Ralph Torrefranca, the Filipino-American Sr. Director of A&R at Angry Mob, The New Normal focuses to uplift underrepresented voices in the music business. The event was supported by BMI, Topo Chico, Shure, JHS Pedals, Izotope, Native Instruments, and Spitfire Audio. The organization plans for future camps in Los Angeles in fall 2023 and Nashville in 2024.

NEED TO MAKE CONTACT, SEND NEWS AND NEW MUSIC RELEASES?: If you have any A&R, publishing, technology, agent/promoter, international radio, management, new media or film/TV music supervisor news you’d like to share with A&R Worldwide, or need to respond to information published in the weekly newsletter please E–mail it to the attention of Sat Bisla at sat@anrworldwide.com. Also, all demos and new music releases should be sent as STREAMING LINKS ONLY to info@anrworldwide.com.

IN THE SPOTLIGHT: Shridhar Subramaniam, Ken Ogihara, Andrew Gould, Rachel Kurstin, Rochelle Holquin, Peymon Maskan, Livy Behar-Rodriguez, Savan Kotecha, Adam Greenup, Samantha Sklar, Josh Favor, Chris Barton, Cathy Mathalone, and Stephen Budd.
